messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman
messages.msgSnippet: Sigh... Truly, Madly, Deeply  sappy but so, so, so much Alan Rickman... Deb L, late to the discussion, I know.
messages.messageBody:
Sigh... "Truly, Madly, Deeply" sappy but so, so, so much Alan Rickman...

Deb L, late to the discussion, I know.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/14/02 9:27:50 PM, liza@culturekitchen.com writes:  All of Jane Austen now
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/14/02 9:27:50 PM, liza@... writes:

<< ANYTHING based on a Jane Austen movie is like a drug to me. >>

All of Jane Austen now reminds me of Black Adder, the third series, Regency.


"Amy and Amiability"
"Nob and Nobility" etc.

The whole set is pictured as romance novels here:

http://www.users.voicenet.com/~thorkill/3adder.html

It's a hoot!

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman
messages.msgSnippet: **BTW: ANYTHING based on a Jane Austen movie is like a drug to me. The best? Bridget Jones Diaries. Second best? The A&E Pride and Prejudice mini-series. Out
messages.messageBody:
**BTW: ANYTHING based on a Jane Austen movie is like a drug to me. The
best? Bridget Jones Diaries. Second best? The A&E Pride and Prejudice
mini-series. Out of this world classic? Pride & Prejudice with Sir
Laurence Olivier. YEAH!**

I like the TV version of Persuasion. Ciaran WhateverHisLastNameIs is
rather Rickmanesque, only maybe a bit cuter.

Plus, the story has a moral about the perils of letting other people run
your life. An important moral for us to consider, here, occasionally,
as we are dishing out advice. :-)

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Alan Rickman
messages.msgSnippet: Is that s the Emma Thompson *Sense and Sensibility*? Gosh, now I have to rent it again! I don t remember him in that movie!!! BTW: ANYTHING based on a Jane
messages.messageBody:
Is that's the Emma Thompson *Sense and Sensibility*? Gosh, now I have
to rent it again! I don't remember him in that movie!!!

BTW: ANYTHING based on a Jane Austen movie is like a drug to me. The
best? Bridget Jones Diaries. Second best? The A&E Pride and Prejudice
mini-series. Out of this world classic? Pride & Prejudice with Sir
Laurence Olivier. YEAH!


>In a message dated 9/14/02 7:06:19 PM Central Daylight Time,
>Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
>
><< Sense and Sensibility" too.
>>
>OOoooh, ooh, ooh....he was SO awesome in that movie. The perfect gentleman.
>
>Ren

messages.msgSnippet: Oops...I guess I m a little behind the thread on Alan Rickman, but I love him, didn t know everyone had already commented on him. Kelli T starsuncloud@cs.com

Oops...I guess I'm a little behind the thread on Alan Rickman, but I love him, didn't know everyone had already commented on him.
Kelli T

starsuncloud@... wrote:In a message dated 9/14/02 2:13:45 PM Central Daylight Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< It's the voice, I swear to god, but that guy is just ultra yummy,
especially when he is playing villains. Do you remember him in Robin
Hood? He stole that movie from what's-his-name? >>

Yep, I agree.
I got some weird looks from dh and bil when I said he was sexy....they didn't
get it.
I loved him in Robin Hood. Kevin Costner stunk.

Ren
